section.title: Purpose
section.para: Scaling an open-source integrated knowledge management tool is essential to ensure it can effectively support growing user bases and knowledge data volumes, thereby improving knowledge sharing and interoperability. This document is an update to a previously submitted deliverable that serves as a summary of findings for best practices and potential methodologies to describe how the development of Integrated Knowledge Management (IKM) will be scaled to a large open-source community while maintaining functional integrity and encouraging new users to contribute within a shared authoring environment. As this effort progresses, these findings will evolve as we continue to understand the requirements, priorities, and needs of IKM and its users.
